results.title: VD questions VD answers
results.creator_credit: Harry Robin, Herbert Bernard and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Explains how venereal diseases are contracted, how to find out if one has the disease, how to prevent or treat the disease, and where to find help. Contains mainly animated and still photography sequences. Animation: Ralph McQuarrie, Gordon Legg.

results.title: VD every thirty seconds
results.brief_description: Every thirty seconds someone is infected with a venereal disease. it is more prevalent in the 15-25 year old group. Points out the ways in which one contracts these diseases and various treatments with emphasis on the importance of prompt medical attention in suspected cases.

results.title: VD attack plan
results.creator_credit: Les Clark and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description:
An animation from the Disney studios dealing with venereal disease; its causes, effects and methods of prevention and treatment.
Suitable for upper primary, secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: VD
results.creator_credit: Richard Leacock and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description: The film was shot in cinema verite style at an information centre, a school and venereal disease clinics. Symptoms and treatment are explained as actual patients visit clinics. Discussion between patients and physicians emphasise a person’s responsibility to themselves and to others if there is a possibility of infection.

results.title: VCS1 and VCS3 Synthesiser, from Don Banks music studio
results.brief_description: The soundtrack to Doctor Who’s battles with the Daleks was made by the VCS3. This portable synthesiser was created in 1969 and was originally commissioned by Australian composer Don Banks who wanted an instrument that would let him work at home.

constellations_primary.name: The Suspense Constellation
constellations_primary.description: An exploration of music in suspense works.

results.title_for_label: VCS1 and VCS3 Synthesiser, from Don Banks music studio
results.description:
The soundtrack to Doctor Who’s battles with the Daleks was made by the VCS3. This portable synthesiser was created in 1969 by Tristram Cary, David Cockerell and Peter Zinovieff at London’s Electronic Music Studio. It was originally commissioned by Australian composer Don Banks who wanted an instrument that would let him work at home.

“Thank heaven for the age of miniaturisation because this was small enough for me to take to bed with headphones and start to explore a new world of sound.” – Don Banks
description_for_label:
The soundtrack to Doctor Who’s battles with the Daleks was made by the VCS3. This portable synthesiser was created in 1969 by Tristram Cary, David Cockerell and Peter Zinovieff at London’s Electronic Music Studio. It was originally commissioned by Australian composer Don Banks who wanted an instrument that would let him work at home.

“Thank heaven for the age of miniaturisation because this was small enough for me to take to bed with headphones and start to explore a new world of sound.” – Don Banks
